node.title: Add simple working example of basic TCN / MomentNetwork structure
node.body:
## Proposed changes

Add a simple example of how a neural network (temporal convolutional network) could be used to construct the moments of a given underlying model.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

## Checklist

- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](../blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) doc
- [x] I am making a pull request against the `main` branch (left side). Also you should start your branch off our `main`.
- [ ] Lint and unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

## Further comments

This is really a minimal working example somewhat outside of the package structure. It should be integrated in the package structure and the PR is being created as discussed with @AldoGl. He will make changes to this PR before integrating it.

nodes.bodyText: Thank you Jonathan, great work! We'll try and integrate your algorithm soon :)

Codecov Report

Merging #58 (35d2742) into main (152aa9b) will not change coverage.
The diff coverage is n/a.

❗ Your organization is not using the GitHub App Integration. As a result you may experience degraded service beginning May 15th. Please install the Github App Integration for your organization. Read more.
Additional details and impacted files

@@           Coverage Diff           @@
##             main      #58   +/-   ##
=======================================
  Coverage   91.36%   91.36%           
=======================================
  Files          42       42           
  Lines        1737     1737           
=======================================
  Hits         1587     1587           
  Misses        150      150

Today I worked on the code and did the following:

I moved modules into appropriate folders (loss_functions, test, example)
I better integrated the code with existing classes (for instance, now the sampler used in the network is a Black-it sampler, and the parameter ranges are specified via a SearchSpace object)
I added an example notebook (where i first compute the optimal moment function, and then I use it within a method of moments calibration)
I fixed typing and linting error as much as possible
I added @JLDC as an author

There is still some work to do, primarily:

write the rest of the docstrings
fix all linting errors
write a test (I added a dummy test, we can start from there)
consider what should be done to extend the code to multiple moments while preserving existing abstractions within the method of moments loss function
@JLDC, could you give access to your fork also to @marcofavoritobi? (no hurry)

@JLDC, could you give access to your fork also to @marcofavoritobi? (no hurry)

He should already have access. Any maintainer is allowed to edit this pull request. Let me know if I am mistaken and I need to undertake something else.

node.bodyText: I guess the last cells can be removed, right? They look like "debugging cells"

an idea to solve it from ChatGPT:
https://chat.openai.com/share/43b7067f-9a6c-47a5-b2a2-9bf64b0ebd8e
can we replace TITLE with the actual paper title?
can we add paper title here? And the other authors?

The title is still somewhat a working title, we might change it but if that is the case I will open a pull request. In the meanwhile, the title is "Constructing Efficient Simulated Moments Using Temporal Convolutional Networks", by Jonathan Chassot and Michael Creel. Link: https://www.jldc.ch/uploads/2023_chassot_creel.pdf

node.title: Flask API 기능 추가
node.body:
[Flask API]
- 사용자 정보 입력
- 사용자 정보 평가
- 초기 질문리스트 생성
- 심화질문 생성
- 답변내용 평가

node.bodyText: 치명적인 부분들은 아니라서, 필요하다고 생각하시는 부분만 바꿔주시면 좋을 것 같습니다!

제가 Type에 대해서 잘 몰라서 GPT에게 물어본 결과, 이러한 답변이 왔습니다.
https://chat.openai.com/share/af7b8700-ca7a-4955-9788-3068ade59912
참고하시고, 고칠 필요가 있다면 고쳐주세요.

이 부분은 하나의 함수로 추출하는 것은 어떤지 의견이 궁금합니다.
InitQuestion 클래스의 17~18 line에서도 check_data_manager로 에러 체크를 하고 시작하는 것으로 볼 때,
에러 체킹을 위한 하나의 메소드로 통합하고, 파라미터로 체크해야 하는 manager 목록을 보내는 식으로?
"질문을 답변하는 과정이 최소 1회 이상 필요합니다." 가 좀 더 자연스러운 문장일 것 같습니다.

ChatManager도 혹시 모를 상황을 위해 에러 체크가 필요할 수도 있을 것 같습니다.
OpenAI API 문제로 정상적으로 LLM을 불러오지 못할 수도 있을 것 같아서요.
(LangChain 메소드를 활용하다 보니 LangChain에서 예외 처리를 해줄 수도 있지만, 그렇더라도 필요하지 않을까 생각합니다)

리뷰 감사합니다.
타입힌트와 함수 통합, 문장 수정도 진행하겠습니다!

모델 생성은 OpenAI에 API를 호출하는 건 없어서 안전합니다. ㅎㅎ
API를 호출하기 전에 어떤 스펙의 모델을 쓸거고, 스트리밍은 쓸거니, 등등...을 미리 정해주는 단계라고 보시면 됩니다!

맞네요. 2개씩 안만들고 하나로 만들어서 파라미터로 체크할 수 있겠네요.
반영하겠습니다!

사실 입력받는 클래스가 정확히 지정되지 않는 파라미터라서 Type이라고 명시를 했었는데
Type은 잘못된 표현이었네요. GPT에게 좀 더 물어본 결과, Any를 쓰는게 맞는 표현이라고 합니다.
나중에 이 부분에서 입력 필터링을 위한 로직이 추가되야겠군요. 아마 llm 쓸 듯..?

파이썬은 아직 잘 모르지만, Exception은 너무 일반화되어 예외의 종류를 바로 파악하기 어렵습니다.
java의 커스텀 예외처럼 만들어보는 건 어떨까요?
TimeoutException 같은 거로 커스텀 하는게..?
Any도 좀 아닌 것 같아서, 궁리하다가 모든 Handler가 BaseCallbackHandler를 상속받으니까 Type[BaseCallbackHandler]로 명시하기로 했습니다.

node.title: Interaction and api updates
node.body:
This branch contains some bug fixes and code improvements.
Most notable changes:

- RSModel interaction now no longer tries to click points that are not in collision with the polygons of the model. This means the success rate for clicking a model is drastically increased. It now gets a random polygon and finds a point within that to click on.
- Added withdrawAll function to Bank
- Added hasAction to RSObject

### Bugs found
See Inventory.java:175 the condition is always true. Author: @Fire-Swan
See RSModel.java:343 this loop always returns with n=0. Author(s): @PhobicHD and/or @GigiaJ

nodes.bodyText:
https://chat.openai.com/share/633e2b6f-6e7b-43e7-8a8a-7fbe47c0aa4b
ChatGPT helped me understand that the first bug is not a big deal.
The second bug also seems like a minor issue fixed. Please confirm the new behaviour is the intended behaviour @PhobicHD @GigiaJ

In commit cd751f6 I only did formatting.
In all the commits I did formatting. Most notably I made sure to make the spaces/tabs consistent. The project mainly uses tabs and so should everyone contributing therefore.
This is going to be a bit of a mess while merging with the other pull requests. I recommend to merge the other requests first, and then resolve the conflicts in IntelliJ when merging.
If I can help with resolving conflicts at some point I would love to.

Now we use the clickbox of the TileObject and try to get the middle of that if it exists. If that is not on screen or it does not exist, the old system is used. The old system tries to get a center polygon of the model on screen. If that also fails, the new system is used which tries to get a random polygon on the screen. The latter does not look specifically for a center and may therefore hit a polygon which is on screen while the middle of the model is not on screen.
Combining these three methods creates a very high success rate for many shapes.
I also changed the click to allow a user to specify how many tries the mouse makes to move onto the object. The default is set from 2 (which was not in a loop) to 3 as a loop.

node.bodyText: Isn't this necessary? What if none of them are found? In that case its going to print a stack trace where are before it would just return false.
I strongly prefer else ifs on newlines not stacked. This is inconsistent through the api though and I think the rest of the file is like this
is there a reason these are different?

This is similar to how it worked before. The problem is because of the screen projection the majority of triangles are going to be at or near the edge of the model in 2d screen space. Couple this together with the fact the model or camera may be moving and the mouse takes time to move. This causes moving the mouse to a model to fail most of the time at least when the model or camera is moving at all. I think that we can actually get the click hitbox somehow and take the center point of that which makes more sense but I didn't spend the time to figure it out. Ideally, our mouse movement would update while moving so it always finished on the model but that isn't how it works currently. Regardless, I don't think this is a good change even though on the surface it seems like a better way to do it. Oh also the name is definitely not apt with this change.

Note I have had some problems with using the definition like this. This should definitely exist and I think it is good how it is though. We shouldn't check this before trying to doAction as the hover menu is much more accurate.

I used this to find an open door. Since a closed door is a different object this works perfectly.
It's currently not being used in the OSRSBot code and is simply available to scripters.
In which case does this not work?
I overlooked. Will be changed in next commit
The entire project is like this and it's the default formatter behaviour of Intellij
In the lines above the bankBooth is set to null if the bankChest is not null. Therefore this is always true.
When interacting with a furnace the old code had a 10% fail rate when zoomed in. An 80% fail rate when zoomed out.

Some objects don't have actions properly defined in their definitions. The easiest example is any of these https://static.runelite.net/api/runelite-api/net/runelite/api/NullObjectID.html like the levers in draynor manor basement. There are a bunch more though where the definition of actions isn't the same as the object in certain game states.
Resolved in commit 06393b7
Resolved in commit c0aa5a3
I've updated the interaction logic
